entry.title: SAP B2B TPM routing of EDIFACT application reference
entry.content:
Hi all,

I have an issue with TPM agreement. We are not able to create 2 flows with same message type in EDIFACT on the same Partner Agreement. We have requirement of different mapping flows depending on Application Reference in UNB segment eg PICK or PACK like below:

UNA:+.? '
UNB+UNOC:3+5031234567890:14+5791234567890:14+250815:1200+11224455++PICK'
UNH+00000000000000+DESADV:D:96A:UN'

and 

UNA:+.? '
UNB+UNOC:3+5031234567890:14+5791234567890:14+250815:1200+11224455++PACK'
UNH+00000000000000+DESADV:D:96A:UN'

Any good ideas?

Regards Brian

#Trading Partner Management

entry.title: TAB Delimited in Message Transformation bean in BTP IS
entry.content:
Hello All

I am doing StructXML2Plain for XML to CSV conversion using MessageTransformationBean groovy. Requirement is to use tab(\t) delimiter.

Unable to get the tab delimited file in the end. File shows Output values with \t instead of actual tab delimited. I have used below combinations - \t  ,  '\t'  , '0x09'  , 0x09 . Nothing works.

Is this the limitation of MTB Groovy or if anyone has done this please suggest

Thanks
Mohit

entry.title: CPU/Memory utilization monitoring and Workload class
entry.content:
Introduction

This document explains how to monitor resource usage in an SAP HANA system, focusing specifically on CPU utilization. Regular monitoring ensures your system runs efficiently, maintains high performance, and uses resources wisely helping to avoid slowdowns and unnecessary costs.

Monitoring CPU Usage in SAP HANA Cloud

SAP HANA Cloud offers multiple tools for monitoring system performance. One of the most accessible and useful is SAP HANA Cloud Central. Follow the steps below to monitor CPU usage effectively:

 

Step 1: Open SAP HANA Cockpit

  • Go to SAP HANA Cloud Central.

  • Right-click on your HANA instance and select "Open SAP HANA Cockpit."

    Step 2: Navigate to CPU Usage

    • In the Cockpit, open the Performance Monitor.

    •  

    • Click on CPU Usage to view current and historical CPU activity.

      Step 3: Analyze the Data

      • Review CPU usage trends over time to identify patterns.

      • Pay close attention to spikes in usage to pinpoint potential performance issues.

        Additional Tools for Monitoring Performance

        Beyond CPU usage, the Performance Monitor provides visibility into other key resources and activities that impact system performance:

        • Expensive Statements: SQL queries that consume high levels of resources. These should be analyzed and optimized first.

        • Running Statements: Shows currently running SQL statements and their resource usage.

        • Alerts: System-generated warnings about unusual activity or performance issues.

        • Background Jobs: Scheduled processes that may impact CPU and memory usage.

          By identifying expensive statements, you can see exactly which queries are causing heavy load, when they ran, and what SQL code was executed. This information is crucial for performance tuning.

          After identifying these queries, you can optimize them—either by improving the SQL logic or by adjusting execution times—so that not all resource-heavy tasks run at the same time. This ensures resources are available for other important or ad hoc operations.

          Managing Resource Consumption with Workload Classes

          To prevent system overloads, one effective strategy is to use Workload Classes. These allow you to set limits on resource usage, such as CPU or memory, ensuring that no user or query consumes more than its fair share.

          What is a Workload Class?

          A workload class defines specific rules for resource usage. When applied, it helps:

          • Prevent overutilization of system resources,

          • Maintain system stability and performance,

          • Allocate resources more fairly across users and tasks.

            Creating a Workload Class

            You can create a workload class either through SAP HANA Cockpit or by using an SQL statement. Once created, it must be assigned to a user to take effect.

            Example 1: Using SQL

             

             
            CREATE WORKLOAD CLASS "SHIGI" SET 'ADMISSION CONTROL REJECT CONTROL REJECT CPU THRESHLD' = '45';

             

             
            Example 2: More Detailed Workload Class

             

             
            CREATE WORKLOAD CLASS MyWorkloadClass STATEMENT MEMORY LIMIT 1 GB STATEMENT THREAD LIMIT 5 STATEMENT QUEUE TIMEOUT 60 SECONDS PRIORITY MEDIUM;
             

            How It Works

            Once a workload class is assigned to a user:

            • Any SQL statement that exceeds the defined limits (CPU, memory, threads, etc.) will be automatically rejected.

            • This ensures critical system resources remain available and protects the system from crashing due to overload.

              Conclusion

              Monitoring and managing resource usage in SAP HANA Cloud is essential for maintaining performance and stability. By regularly checking CPU and memory consumption, identifying expensive queries, and using workload classes, you can keep your system healthy and efficient—no matter how demanding the workload.

entry.title: Using SAP CPI to Perform POST Calls on SAP Datasphere OData API
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

In my current scenario, I need to perform both GET and POST operations on an OData API exposed from SAP Datasphere. Querying records works fine using OAuth 2.0 with the Authorization Code grant type.

Now, I have another use case where I need to push data from SAP CPI into Datasphere for integration purposes. While I know that data loading can be done using the JDBC adapter in CPI, I would prefer an API-based approach.

The key challenge I’m facing is around executing a POST request to insert records directly into Datasphere tables. Does Datasphere support inserting data into its tables via APIs, or is there a workaround required to achieve this?

If anyone has implemented this in a project, I would really appreciate your insights.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Reusable_Groovy_Scripts_V2 are not available
entry.content:
I am working on creating an end-to-end TPM scenario from EDI to IDoc. I have followed all the required steps, but I’m encountering the following error:

Error: com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.processor.ScriptCollectionException:
Service references of CompiledScriptProvider for referenced script collection Reusable_Groovy_Scripts_V2 are not available
I have already deployed all the required iFlows as well as the Reusable_Groovy_Scripts_V2 package, but the error still persists.

Has anyone faced this issue before or can guide me on what might be missing?

Thanks.

entry.title: Filtering in Advanced Event Mesh from IDOC
entry.content:
Hi All,

The client is on ECC and they are using CPI to connect to a 3rd party system via BTP Advanced Event Mesh(AEM).

CPI gets an IDoc from SAP ECC and they route it via AEM Topic which needs to be filtered out in AEM based on a customer account group 0002 & 0003.

How do we set this filter at the AEM topic/subscription level instead of setting up in CPI.

Thanks

entry.title: EDI to XML Converter Not working XSD Schema Issue
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need to convert the EDIFACT file to XML but it is showing this error. I generated the XSD using the blog mentioned below -

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/step-by-step-process-to-download-edifact-xsds-from-integration-advisor-for/ba-p/13626288

Configuration for EDI to XML converter as mentioned below -

Failing at the step with the error details mentioned below -

Error Details
com.sap.it.rt.edi.exception.EDIHandlerException: Processing failed due to issues in either Interchange header or Message Header.
 
When I am trying to validate XSD and XML, it gives error S_UNA/S_UNB element is used but not declared in the DTD/Schema.
 
I am unable to Attach the XML and XSD files here, please suggest what is wrong from my end and how can it be resolved.
 
Thanks.
 
Best Regards,
Nidhi Srivastava

entry.title: What are the required steps to enable replication from SAP S/4HANA On-Premise to SAP MDG, cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to replicate Business Partners from SAP S/4HANA On-Premise to SAP MDG, cloud edition.

According to the Deep-Dive: SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition documentation, this should be possible. However, the documentation only describes the configuration steps for SAP S/4HANA Cloud → MDG Cloud (via Communication Arrangements) Create Communication Arrangement | SAP Help Portal.

So my question is: : What are the required steps to enable replication from SAP S/4HANA On-Premise to SAP MDG, cloud edition?

entry.title: How to restrict visibility of integration packages in SAP CPI (Integration Suite)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a project where we create integration flows for multiple countries in SAP CPI (Integration Suite). Each country has its own set of CPI developers who should only work on their respective country’s packages/iflows and I need to restrict access to certain integration packages so that some users cannot see or access them.

Our requirement is:

  • Country A developers should only see and work on Country A’s packages.

  • Country B developers should only see and work on Country B’s packages.

  • And so on…

I have checked Access Policies they do not prevent users from seeing the other packages/iflows in the tenant.

My questions:

  1. Is there a way to completely hide integration packages from developers who are not authorized?

  2. If full visibility restriction is not possible, what are the recommended best practices for structuring roles and access policies in such multi-country projects?

  3. Is there any roadmap from SAP to introduce package-level visibility restrictions in CPI?

Any advice or workaround would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!


SAP Integration Suite

entry.title: CPI | Override SOAP Adapter response encoding format
entry.content:
Hello,

Scenario:

SOAP Adapter accepts the incoming request does some transformation and sends the data to External HTTP receiver, and we get response text in Polish language. Ex. KitchenAid® 26.8 CuFt FDBM Ref WD, BSS

 

Problem:

My expectation is Encoding remains in UTF-8. Which I see till end of message.

However when SOAP Adapter sends the response back to caller it always overrides and converts to Encoding: ISO-8859-1.

 

Note that am not setting any content-type or charset anywhere in headers. When I did try, adapter still overrides it. You can see the behavior in above screenshots captured during trace.

Is this always the expected behavior or am I missing something?

Thank you,

Bhuvana

entry.title: JDBC (Microsoft SQL) Connectivity issue In SAP CPI
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm trying to establish a connection to an on prem Microsoft SQL server via JDBC adapter in SAP CPI. I'm getting an error
org.springframework.jdbc.CannotGetJdbcConnectionException: Failed to obtain JDBC Connection; nested exception is com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The TCP/IP connection to the host localhost, port 1106 has failed. Error: "The driver received an unexpected pre-login response. Verify the connection properties and check that an instance of SQL Server is running on the host and accepting TCP/IP connections at the port. This driver can be used only with SQL Server 2005 or later.". ClientConnectionId:1fe33d15-3b89-41fa-b211-672cb643ff12, cause: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The TCP/IP connection to the host localhost, port 1106 has failed. Error: "The driver received an unexpected pre-login response. Verify the connection properties and check that an instance of SQL Server is running on the host and accepting TCP/IP connections at the port. This driver can be used only with SQL Server 2005 or later.". ClientConnectionId:1fe33d15-3b89-41fa-b211-672cb643ff12
The driver I've installed in CPI is V8.4.1

My JDBC configuration is 

Is this the correct driver version I'm using, and in the error, it mentions port as 1106, I've not maintained that port, why is it coming in the error? How do I resolve this error?

Please help.

Thanks in advance!
Shreyas.

entry.title: Evaluating Risks of Non-VPN Access to SAP BTP Cockpit
entry.content:
Hello,

Is it standard practice for users to access the SAP BTP Cockpit using only company-issued S-user credentials—without requiring VPN or corporate network access? While this setup does offer convenience, it also raises potential security concerns. For instance, logging in from a personal device over the public internet, without any corporate network safeguards, could expose sensitive assets.
Would appreciate your thoughts on this. Thanks in advance.

Thanks

entry.title: SAP BTP Neo Environment: Problem calling iflow from SAP Fiori
entry.content:
Hi everyone
I developed an application in SAPUI5 in a Neo environment. Running the application from SAP Web IDE Full-Stack (version: 201119) works correctly, but when deploying it to SAP Fiori, I receive a 405 error.

SAP Web Ide full

 

It is evident from sap fiori that it returns status 405

It uses a destination with an OAuth2ClientCredentials, and neo-app.json and manifest.json are configured for destinations.

 

Any suggestions on how to resolve this error?

entry.title: In SAP CPI, the iFlow stops processing in the middle of execution.
entry.content:
In SAP CPI, from the main iFlow I am calling 50 different iFlows (streaming) through ProcessDirect. Each iFlow may take between 1 to 10 seconds to complete.

In some scenarios, the iFlow stops processing after completing ~30 requests, while in other scenarios it completes all requests.

What is the best way to handle this situation?

entry.title: how can I map by seeing the fields in mapping sheet
entry.content: first how can I prepare an XSLT file for mapping

entry.title: Remove Suppress Groovy script for CPI Message Mapping
entry.content:
import com.sap.it.api.mapping.*

def void removeSuppress(String[] values, Output output, MappingContext context) {
def filtered = values.findAll { v -> v != null && !output.isSuppress(v) }
filtered.each { v -> output.addValue(v) }
}

entry.title: Unable to extract EDI format message from Mail Sender Adapter
entry.content:

UNA:+.? '

NAD+DP+4399902XXXX::9'

UNT+22+1'
UNZ+1+2468'

How to extract EDI payload from Mail adapter and convert in XML and modules.

Thanks,

Nidhi Srivastava

entry.title: SAP Cloud Integration - Best approach to connect SAP PO 7.5 to CPI HTTPS endpoint with CSRF enabled
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a requirement to connect from SAP PO 7.5 (using the REST adapter) to a CPI HTTPS endpoint where CSRF protection is enabled.
Our goal is to achieve this integration with minimal changes to the existing SAP PO iFlow.

  • What is the recommended approach to handle the CSRF token in this scenario?

  • Is it necessary to implement an Async-Sync Bridge on the PO side, or are there more efficient alternatives to manage the token exchange?

Any guidance, best practices, or references would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,

Niranjan Nayak

entry.title: Account integration Sales Cloud v2 with S4
entry.content:
Hello, 

We have integration flow for Business Partner replication from Sales V2 to SAP S4HANA Public Cloud. After replication S4 responses with following errors that 4 Partner Functions are missing:

-Mandatory partner function SP is missing for sales area 1000 10 10

-Mandatory partner function BP is missing for sales area 1000 10 10

-Mandatory partner function PY is missing for sales area 1000 10 10

-Mandatory partner function SH is missing for sales area 1000 10 10

We can't fill these Partner Functions because Sales V2 does not send it in the payload as result of change event. So we are not able to fill these nodes with Partner Functions, so we get errors above.

 

We tried to fill it with "constant values" at CPI so S4 receives these predefined payload (SP role code and this party ID exists in the target system, see attch).

But in that case S4 replies with following error (see attch.)

Maybe someone can help me with this issue?
